ImageDescription.soustitre: Each image carrying information has a textual alternative. On the opposite, an image should not be described if it does not provide information

UXRoadMap.check: Please check the box once the instruction is verified

UXCheckBoxList.un: The alternatives for relevant images are defined (on the model or in the comments block)
UXCheckBoxList.deux: Image captions, if they exist, are defined
UXCheckBoxList.trois: Descriptions of complex images are defined

UXGoodPractice.texte: The description of the image itself will not provide relevant information
UXGoodPractice.deux: A thumbnail representing the cover of a document to be downloaded will not need to be described: the title of the document, the format and the size of the file will be sufficient.

DevelopCheckBoxList.un: Relevant image alternatives are associated with their images
DevelopCheckBoxList.deux: Image captions, if they exist, are defineds
DevelopCheckBoxList.trois: Descriptions of complex images are defined

DevelopGoodPractice.texte: Each text image carrying information, in the absence of a replacement mechanism, must if possible be replaced by stylish text: Use HTML texts, formatted using CSS styles.
DevelopGoodPractice.deux: Give each img image, decorative area an empty alt attribute
DevelopGoodPractice.trois: Leave the contents of the objects and canvas elements empty: <object></object> <canvas></canvas>
DevelopGoodPractice.quatre: The adjacent caption is contained in a tag

FuncCheckBoxList.un: The texts (alternatives, captions, descriptions) are defined in a relevant manner
FuncCheckBoxList.deux: Relevant images carry a detailed description if necessary
FuncCheckBoxList.trois: Descriptions of complex images are defined
FuncCheckBoxList.quatre: Image captions, if they exist, are defineds

FuncGoodPractice.texte: Expected replacement texts NB: an alt type alternative must remain concise (120 characters maximum)
FuncGoodPractice.deux: An image has no point in being described if it does not provide information
